resources.string:
Tips

π is a mathematical constant, approximately equal to 3.14159

e, also known as Euler's number, is a mathematical constant approximately equal to 2.71828

exp stands for exponential, the number before the E is multiplied by 10 to the power of the number after

 sine and cosine are trigonometric functions of an angle

tangent of an angle is the trigonometric ratio between the adjacent side and the opposite side of a right triangle containing that angle

arcsine of x is defined as the inverse sine function of x, the same applies for arctangent and arccosine

The square root √ of a number is another number which produces the first number when it is multiplied by itself

ln or natural logarithm of a number is its logarithm to the base of the mathematical constant e

log returns the base 10 logarithm of a number

AX and A2 are your exponents/powers and so should be used to multiply the number by itself the inputted amount of times
